scenarios.name: Create Formula-Based Metric with Weekly Cadence and Custom Target
scenarios.description: This end-to-end scenario verifies the successful creation of a new metric using a formula, setting a weekly cadence which reveals the conditional 'Resets On' field, adding the metric to 'My KPIs' on the dashboard, and configuring a 4-level Custom Target.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the Application and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
Step 3: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
Step 4: Select the specified company from the list.
Step 5: Verify the dashboard page is displayed after successful login.
Step 6: Navigate to the Metrics page via the navigation menu.
Step 7: Click the 'Add Metric' button to open the creation form.
Step 8: Enter the metric name in the 'Name' input field.
Step 9: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 10: Verify the 'Formula Builder' interface is visible.
Step 11: Search for and select the first metric for the formula.
Step 12: Click on the desired operator button.
Step 13: Search for and select the second metric for the formula.
Step 14: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
Step 14A: Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Step 14B: Verify the 'Resets On' dropdown appears and select a day of the week.
Step 15: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Step 17: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
Step 18: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the main navigation.
Step 19: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the KPI management modal.
Step 20: Search for the newly created metric in the modal.
Step 21: Locate the metric in the left panel of available metrics.
Step 22: Click the metric in the left panel to move it to the right panel.
Step 23: Click the 'Save' button in the modal to update the dashboard KPIs.
Step 24: Wait for the dashboard to render and identify the new metric card.
Step 25: Locate the correct metric card, selecting the last one if duplicates exist.
Step 26: Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
Step 27: Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown menu.
Step 28: Identify the active dropdown menu.
Step 29: Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
Step 30: Wait for the Edit page to load completely.
Step 31: Select the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
Step 32A.1: Click the 'Custom' radio button.
Step 32A.2: Verify that 4 target input fields appear.
Step 32A.3: Enter the Level 1 target value.
Step 32A.4: Enter the Level 2 target value.
Step 32A.5: Enter the Level 3 target value.
Step 32A.6: Enter the Level 4 target value.
Step 33: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
Step 34: Verify the page navigates back to the dashboard after saving.
Step 35: Verify the metric card on the dashboard displays the custom target indicators.
Step 36: Perform a final verification of the metric card's name, value, and target visualization.
acceptance_criteria: The user successfully logs in and navigates to the Metrics page.
The 'Resets On' field correctly appears when 'Weekly' cadence is selected.
The formula is built and saved without errors.
The new metric is successfully added to the 'My KPIs' section of the dashboard.
The user can successfully navigate to the metric's Edit page from the dashboard card.
The Custom Target fields appear when the 'Custom' radio button is selected.
The four custom target values are entered and saved successfully.
The application navigates back to the dashboard after saving the target.
The metric card on the dashboard visually reflects the newly configured Custom Target.
test_data_requirements: resets_on: A valid day of the week (e.g., 'Monday')
first_metric: Name of a valid, existing metric
second_metric: Name of a second valid, existing metric
custom_target_values: 4 numeric values in descending order

scenarios.name: Create Metric from Existing Metric with Monthly Cadence and Time-Based Target
scenarios.description: This end-to-end scenario verifies the successful creation of a new metric by linking to an existing metric, setting a monthly cadence, adding it to the dashboard, and configuring a Time-Based Target with a start and end value.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the Application and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
Step 3: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
Step 4: Select the specified company from the list.
Step 5: Verify the dashboard page is displayed after successful login.
Step 6: Navigate to the Metrics page via the navigation menu.
Step 7: Click the 'Add Metric' button to open the creation form.
Step 8: Enter the metric name in the 'Name' input field.
Step 9: Select 'Metric' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 10-ALT: Verify the metric selection interface is visible.
Step 11-ALT: Search for and select an existing metric.
Step 14A: Select 'Monthly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Step 17: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
Step 18: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the main navigation.
Step 19: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the KPI management modal.
Step 21: Locate the metric in the left panel of available metrics.
Step 22: Click the metric in the left panel to move it to the right panel.
Step 23: Click the 'Save' button in the modal to update the dashboard KPIs.
Step 25: Locate the correct metric card on the dashboard.
Step 26: Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
Step 27: Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown menu.
Step 29: Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
Step 31: Select the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
Step 32B.1: Click the 'Time-Based' radio button.
Step 32B.2: Verify that 'Start' and 'Target' input fields appear.
Step 32B.3: Enter the Start value.
Step 32B.4: Enter the Target value.
Step 33: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
Step 34: Verify the page navigates back to the dashboard after saving.

Step 36: Perform a final verification of the metric card's name, value, and target visualization.
acceptance_criteria: The user successfully logs in and creates a metric based on an existing metric.
The 'Resets On' field does not appear for 'Monthly' cadence.
The new metric is successfully saved and added to the 'My KPIs' section.
The user can successfully navigate to the metric's Edit page.
The Time-Based Target fields appear when the 'Time-Based' radio button is selected.
The Start and Target values are entered and saved successfully.
The application redirects to the dashboard after saving the target.
The metric card on the dashboard visually reflects the newly configured Time-Based Target.
test_data_requirements: metric_to_select: Name of a valid, existing metric
time_based_target_value: A numeric target value greater than the start value

scenarios.name: Create Formula-Based Metric with Quarterly Cadence and Add to Dashboard
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the successful creation of a formula-based metric with a quarterly cadence and confirms it can be successfully added to the 'My KPIs' dashboard section without configuring a target.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the Application and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
Step 3: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
Step 4: Select the specified company from the list.
Step 6: Navigate to the Metrics page via the navigation menu.
Step 7: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
Step 8: Enter the metric name.
Step 9: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 11: Search for and select the first metric for the formula.
Step 12: Click on an operator button.
Step 13: Search for and select the second metric for the formula.
Step 14A: Select 'Quarterly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Step 15: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Step 17: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
Step 18: Navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
Step 19: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon.
Step 21: Locate the new metric in the available metrics panel.
Step 22: Click the metric to add it to the selected KPIs.
Step 23: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
Step 24: Wait for the dashboard to refresh.
Step 25: Locate the correct metric card on the dashboard.
Step 36: Verify the metric card is present on the dashboard with its name and current value, but without any target visualization.
acceptance_criteria: A new metric using a formula and quarterly cadence is created successfully.
The metric appears in the list of available KPIs in the 'Edit KPI' modal.
The metric can be successfully added to the 'My KPIs' section.
The dashboard refreshes and displays the new metric card.
The metric card correctly shows the metric name and value, and does not display any target indicators.
test_data_requirements: first_metric: Name of a valid, existing metric
second_metric: Name of a second valid, existing metric
target_type: 'None' or leave target fields empty

dependencies: A valid, active user account with the specified credentials must exist.
The user account must have access to the specified company.

For scenarios using 'Formula' or 'Metric' as a value source, the prerequisite metrics (e.g., 'First Metric', 'Second Metric', 'Metric to Select') must exist in the system and be accessible to the user.
The application must be available at the specified base URL.
edge_cases: Successfully creating a metric with the maximum allowed character length in its name.
Successfully configuring a weekly metric that resets on Sunday.
Successfully configuring a Time-Based target where the start and target values are the same.
Successfully adding the last available metric from the 'Edit KPI' modal to the dashboard.

test_data.metric_name: [Name of the metric to be created]
test_data.resets_on: [Day of week - only if Cadence = Weekly]
test_data.first_metric: [Name of first metric to use in formula]
test_data.second_metric: [Name of second metric to use in formula]
test_data.custom_target_values: [4 values from highest to lowest - Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, Level 4]
